solution_line_template: The cost of the popcorn is ${ticket_cost} x {popcorn_percentage} = $<<{ticket_cost}*{popcorn_percentage}={popcorn_cost}>>{popcorn_cost}.
The cost of a can of soda is ${popcorn_cost} x {soda_percentage} = $<<{popcorn_cost}*{soda_percentage}={soda_cost}>>{soda_cost}.
The cost of {num_tickets} tickets is ${ticket_cost} x {num_tickets} = $<<{ticket_cost}*{num_tickets}={total_ticket_cost}>>{total_ticket_cost}.
The cost of {num_popcorn_sets} sets of popcorn is ${popcorn_cost} x {num_popcorn_sets} = $<<{popcorn_cost}*{num_popcorn_sets}={total_popcorn_cost}>>{total_popcorn_cost}.
The cost of {num_soda_cans} cans of soda is ${soda_cost} x {num_soda_cans} = $<<{soda_cost}*{num_soda_cans}={total_soda_cost}>>{total_soda_cost}.
Therefore, the family paid a total of ${total_ticket_cost} + ${total_popcorn_cost} + ${total_soda_cost} = $<<{total_ticket_cost}+{total_popcorn_cost}+{total_soda_cost}={total_spent}>>{total_spent}.
